text.text_translated: I used to work a typical five-day week, but after I returned from leave for my children, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with them before they start school. After discussing it with my boss, we agreed to reduce my schedule to a three-day work week. Of course, this also meant a significant cut in my pay, because my salary is based on the number of days I work. However, I have noticed since then that my amount of work has not gone down at all. I am now doing five days' worth of work in only three days, but I am getting paid much less for it.
